name: Gables Guest House

reviews.text: Cosy rooms with beautiful bedding (including lots of comfy cushions!) & a good range of TV channels. Lots of little extras (eg: chocolates in our room). Excellent breakfast selection as well. There was a small amount of noise from the main road outside but this did not disturb our sleep.
reviews.title: Perfect - just what we were looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and relaxing stay, exactly what we were looking for. My wife and i enjoyed our stay and the breakfast was great. The food was tasty and the landlady was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We had a box of chocolates and flowers in the room nice touch for Valentine's day.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst trying to get home in the snow I was stranded opposite the Gables! At that point I would not have cared what the place was like. However I was bowled over by the friendliness and helpfulness of the owners. I have stayed in a few places recently in Oxford and the owners have been less than welcoming, This couple however were born to be in the hospitality trade. I was given directions to the pub and takeaway. Broadband was available. My room had chocolates and a decanter!. Also a dressing gown and hot water bottle were in the wardrobe (not needed however as I was like toast) Also a trouser press. Then in the morning whilst I had breakfast (A varied choice which was nice) Sally's husband turned up with a shovel and wellies and dug my car out of the snow. I would like to offer my gratitude for all their help and will certainly be booking here when i next need to stay in Oxford.
reviews.title: Good B&B - although a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good experience with this B&B - service, breakfast and cleanliness was all great.
reviews.title: Average B and B, small rooms, but very pleasant host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked staying at this place - lovely service, nice room and with really big bed (we had the king size bed). There were many many good points and I have very little to complain about with staying here, so let's start with the positives.
reviews.title: very lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - breakfast - lots of selection, even if I didn't love the vegetarian option as much as I though, at least there were some and most would love it
reviews.title: Friendly service but cramped room

reviews.text: - the bedroom
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Oxford

reviews.text: - the amenities
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the friendliness and service
reviews.title: Lovely guesthouse right by the city centre.

reviews.text: We had two nights at Gables Guest House and could not fault the service and facilities. Very thoughtfully decorated with comfortable rooms. Friendly landlady. Good selection at breakfast in a pleasant dining room. Nothing was too much trouble and Sally and Tony were very helpful. Conveniently located. Would be very happy to stay there again and recommend it highly to fellow travellers.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: Very nice guest house. Extremely clean. Owners have put in some very thoughtful touches with spare blankets, loads of towels and other small luxuries. Shower was good temperature and with sufficient force. I was a little worried about possible road noise, but that was not a problem in spite of a room in the front of the house. I would go again.
reviews.title: Very Good Guest House

reviews.text: Sally is extremely nice. The room is comfortable, though a bit cosy for us.
reviews.title: Nice landlady, cosy en-suite room

reviews.text: A true delight to stay here - nothing was too much trouble for the owners - Sally and Tony.
reviews.title: A priceless GEM

reviews.text: They delivered service over and above what was paid for - spotlessly clean rooms and
reviews.title: Excellent guest house for vistors to Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know how good a place is when you are struggling to find anything wrong with it. Shower head hose in bath needs replacing; bit of grouting by bed missing but apart from that… Well-equipped room; everything scrupulously clean. Sally, the landlady, has a natural talent for what she does. Welcoming, informative and good-natured; nothing is too much trouble for her. We had a very pleasant two nights at the Grange and we cannot recommend it highly enough. Excellent is all respects.
reviews.title: A fabulous B&B. Difficult to fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am writing this immediately after a two day stay at The Gables, to celebrate my birthday
reviews.title: A perfect guesthouse.

reviews.text: I would like to thank the landlady for a superb stay, and cannot fault the service provided.
reviews.title: Very friendly family guest house

reviews.text: As a family-run affair, you can come and go as you please, the en-suite room was immaculate and no request was too much
reviews.title: A Must-Stay when in Oxford

reviews.text: An ideal stay for people wishing to explore the beautiful city of Oxford.
reviews.title: A great B&B

description: Award winning bed and breakfast run by former Landlady of the Year, Sally Tompkins. Guests can be sure of a warm welcome and friendly atmosphere. High quality and peaceful rooms providing every comfort for business and leisure travellers, including wifi internet, flat screen tvs/iphone docks, direct dial telephone, beverage trays. Only a few minutes walk to local restaurants and a short bus ride to city centre. Free on site parking for guests.
